OFFICE OF REV. W. S. CLAIBORNE, SECRETARY
MONTEAGLE, TENNESSEE
September 24th 1925
Miss Laura Carter,
West Moreland Apartments,
Washington,
D. C.
My dear Laura:
div1.p:
Just as I reached home, I was called away again
so have not had time to be decent.

You have no idea what a privilege it was to come
on to Washington and be with you in your great affliction and
to meet the family. I tried the best I could to carry out
the services as Cousin Henry would wish them to be and Dr.
Smith was lovely and Mr. Russell was an old friend of mine
of many years standing, he is one of God's saints. I did
want to stay in Ashland so bad and see the folks but I had
to hurry on.

Now remember, I am at your services at any time.
May God bless you and help you in your great sorrow. Be
careful and don't overdo it.
div1.closer: Yours faithfully, W. S. Claibourne WSC/deR.
